Detailed Description

Write one single DSI request. The writer combines both, a buffer interface and the actual output channel. Therefore, it may be possible to use a shared memory segment as buffer and send control messages via the channel. The current implementation just uses a heap-based memory buffer sending the data via a socket-based channel.

Member Function Documentation

size_t avail (  )  const [inline]
Returns:
how many space is still available in the buffer.
bool flush (  ) 

Finalize the current request by sending out all yet unsent data. This can be called exactly once for each request object, you must instantiate a new one if you want to send another request.

int32_t getSequenceNumber (  )  const [inline]
Returns:
the requests sequence number as set/generated by the constructor.
char* pptr (  )  [inline]
Returns:
a put pointer where data can be written to. Make sure the buffer has enough space available before writing into it via e.g. memcpy.
void sbrk ( size_t  amount  )  [inline]

Make more space available by either writing out data or increasing buffer space (internal policy dependent).

Parameters:
amount Minimum increment size for the new buffer.
